site_name: CHARLES Mc GINNIS & DEBBI Mc GINNIS

citations.narrative:
Two outdoor enclosures, housing a total of 7 adult dogs, did not provide sufficient shade for the dogs. The enclosure
housing 4 dogs had no shade at the time of the inspection. The enclosure housing 3 dogs had about 3 inches of shade
but was not a large enough area for all 3 dogs to be protected from the sun. Shade is necessary to protect the dogs from
the direct rays of the sun for their health, comfort, and well-being. The licensee must ensure that in addition to the shelter
structures, one or more separate outside areas of shade are provided. Shade must be provided throughout the day and
must be a large enough area to contain all the animals at one time.
TO BE CORRECTED BY APRIL 12, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.4(b) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
Two outdoor enclosures, housing a total of 7 adult dogs, did not provide sufficient shade for the dogs.  The enclosure 
housing 4 dogs had no shade at the time of the inspection.  The enclosure housing 3 dogs had about 3 inches of shade 
but was not a large enough area for all 3 dogs to be protected from the sun.  Shade is necessary to protect the dogs from 
the direct rays of the sun for their health, comfort, and well-being.  The licensee must ensure that in addition to the shelter 
structures, one or more separate outside areas of shade are provided.  Shade must be provided throughout the day and 
must be a large enough area to contain all the animals at one time. 
TO BE CORRECTED BY APRIL 12, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
